original: Mushrooms have been referenced in literature since the time of the ancient Greek playwright Euripides (480–406 BC). The philosopher Theophrastus of Eresos (371–288 BC) is often regarded as one of the first to attempt a systematic classification of plants, categorizing mushrooms as plants lacking certain organs.
